dt.t: a lawyer who {wi}deals{/wi} with real estate law

dt: {bc}to take action with regard to someone or something

dt.t: Who's going to {wi}deal{/wi} with this mess?

dt: {bc}to reach or try to reach a state of acceptance or reconcilement

dt.t: trying to {wi}deal{/wi} with her son's death

dt: {bc}to sell or distribute something as a business

pt: {sc}distribute{/sc} {sc}dispense{/sc} {sc}divide{/sc} {sc}deal{/sc} {sc}dole out{/sc} mean to give out, usually in shares, to each member of a group. {sc}distribute{/sc} implies an apportioning by separation of something into parts, units, or amounts.
{sc}dispense{/sc} suggests the giving of a carefully weighed or measured portion to each of a group according to due or need.
{sc}divide{/sc} stresses the separation of a whole into parts and implies that the parts are equal.
{sc}deal{/sc} emphasizes the allotment of something piece by piece.
{sc}dole out{/sc} implies a carefully measured portion of something that is often in short supply.

pt.t: {it}doled out{/it} what little food there was

shortdef: to take action with regard to someone or something
to reach or try to reach a state of acceptance or reconcilement

dt: {bc}to hit (someone or something) so as to cause harm

dt.t: The factory closing will {it}deal a{/it} serious/severe/devastating/crushing {it}blow{/it} to the town's economy.
Her career as an ice skater was {phrase}dealt a fatal blow{/phrase} when she broke her leg.

shortdef: to hit (someone or something) so as to cause harm —usually used figuratively

dt: {bc}to buy and sell (something) as a business

dt.t: We don't {it}deal in{/it} rumor or gossip.
"Do you want to play cards with us?" "Sure, {it}deal{/it} me {it}in{/it}."

shortdef: to buy and sell (something) as a business
to use or be involved in (something)
to include (someone) in a card game

dt: {bc}to be about (something) {bc}to have (something) as a subject

dt.t: Her speech {it}dealt with{/it} health care and the nation's economy.
The film {it}deals with{/it} some serious issues.
Their salespeople are very easy to {it}deal with{/it}.

dt: {bc}to do something about (a person or thing that causes a problem or difficult situation)

dt.t: We weren't able/equipped/prepared to {it}deal with{/it} such a large crowd of people.

dt: {bc}to accept or try to accept (something that is true and cannot be changed)

dt.t: She's still trying to {it}deal with{/it} his death.
The weather is bad, but we'll just have to {it}deal with{/it} it.

shortdef: to be about (something) : to have (something) as a subject
to do something about (a person or thing that causes a problem or difficult situation)
